alert.note: Alert for Bertie (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 4:13AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast North Carolina, including the following county, Bertie. * WHEN...Until 530 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 411 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms overnight. The rainfall has ended. However, between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Windsor, Midway, Merry Hill, Woodard, Edenhouse and Mount Gould. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
